private_information: Disks on this peg from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E
peg_left.goal: Report the current stack of disks on the left peg and provide available top-disk move information to the orchestrator.

peg_middle.goal: Report the current stack of disks on the middle peg and provide available top-disk move information to the orchestrator.

peg_right.goal: Report the current stack of disks on the right peg and provide available top-disk move information to the orchestrator.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg reports and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem formatted for the FastDownwards solver that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance by moving all disks from the left peg to the right peg.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left middle and right.
There are five disks labelled A B C D E where A is the smallest and E is the largest.
Only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E, middle empty, right empty.
Goal configuration: right peg top-to-bottom A B C D E and left and middle pegs empty.

state_report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the left peg. Provide a concise structured report of the peg state listing disks from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL. Include which disk is on top and whether the peg is empty.
state_report.prompt: Your name is peg_left. Public information about the environment: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->peg_left->private_information}. Your role: {agents->peg_left->goal}. Report the peg state as a short structured string like 'top:A stack:[A,B,C,D,E]' or 'empty'.

state_report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the middle peg. Provide a concise structured report of the peg state listing disks from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL. Include which disk is on top and whether the peg is empty.
state_report.prompt: Your name is peg_middle. Public information about the environment: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->peg_middle->private_information}. Your role: {agents->peg_middle->goal}. Report the peg state as a short structured string like 'empty' or 'top:X stack:[...]'.

state_report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the right peg. Provide a concise structured report of the peg state listing disks from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL. Include which disk is on top and whether the peg is empty.
state_report.prompt: Your name is peg_right. Public information about the environment: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->peg_right->private_information}. Your role: {agents->peg_right->goal}. Report the peg state as a short structured string like 'empty' or 'top:X stack:[...]'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL planning and in producing problem instances tailored for the FastDownwards solver. Using the peg reports you will produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi rules. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain must include types disk and peg predicates to represent disk stacking and clear tops and must enforce the constraint that a disk can move only if it is the top disk on its peg and it is placed on an empty peg or on a larger disk. The problem must declare the five disks A B C D E and the three pegs left middle right and set the initial state according to the peg reports and the goal of moving all disks to the right peg in correct order. Target the FastDownwards solver conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You have to integrate peg state reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownwards that will solve the Tower of Hanoi instance described by the environment goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Inputs provided: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right}. Think step by step and produce first the domain then the problem. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and predicates clear and unambiguous so FastDownwards can parse them.
